revised_title: Elastic Warping of Graphitic Carbon Sheets: Relative Energies of Fullerenes, Schwarzites, and Buckytubes
tldr: The authors propose a simple elastic model to compare the energies of hypothetical and existing graphitic carbon networks with hyperbolic, elliptic, and parabolic curvatures. They discuss the warping energy required to form closed-shell fullerenes, open hyperbolic schwarzites, and other carbon structures. The model accounts for the relative self-energies of most curved graphitic networks, suggesting that many proposed allotropes of carbon can be treated as two-dimensional warped layer-structures.
